vmassol1 - (11:11): hi angel  
sburjan - (11:11): :)  
sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 11:12  
sdumitriu - (11:12): Hi sburjan  
sburjan - (11:12): Hi sdumitriu  
sdumitriu - (11:12): Can you test the release?  
sburjan - (11:13): yes  
sburjan - (11:14): downloading now  
sburjan - (11:14): the RC1 release  
Baur left at 11:38 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds  
sburjan - (11:46): .zip seems fine. Now testing the JAR installer  
tmortagne - (11:47): vmassol1: is it expected that clirr is executed on plugins ?  
vmassol1 - (11:48): tmortagne: hmmm it's a good thing no?  
vmassol1 - (11:48): wait  
tmortagne - (11:48): i don't say  it's bad, but i'm surprised it is since there is not "internal" package and stuff in plugins  
vmassol1 - (11:48): the build is working fine  
vmassol1 - (11:48): that's strange  
tmortagne - (11:48): not in hudson  
tmortagne - (11:49): hudson say that tag plugin contains an API brakeage  
tmortagne - (11:49): s/brakeage/breakage/  
tmortagne - (11:50): see http://hudson.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-plugin-tag/337/console  
vmassol1 - (11:51): I need to check our clirr config since I don't see how it can work since I thought we specify the previous version  
vmassol1 - (11:51): let me check  
tmortagne - (11:51): no  
tmortagne - (11:51): we specify onee for core  
vmassol1 - (11:52): ok good then  
tmortagne - (11:52): but clirr take the previous non snapshot by default  
tmortagne - (11:52): so for tag it takes 1.14 to compare to 1.15-SNAPSHOT  
vmassol1 - (11:52): I still don't understand why it builds locally  
vmassol1 - (11:53): unless someone modified the tag plugin recently  
vmassol1 - (11:53): and introduced a breakage  
tmortagne - (11:53): if clear say there is a difference between 1.14 and 1.15-SNAPSHOT i guess it is right  
vmassol1 - (11:54): yes I need to undestand why platform builds fine locally  
tmortagne - (11:54): but that's not really what I'm worried about  
cjdelisle - (11:54): maven3?  
vmassol1 - (11:54): I doubt that  
tmortagne - (11:54): s/clear/cliir/  
vmassol1 - (11:54): especially since I built it with mvn 2.2.1 yesterday  
vmassol1 - (11:55): tmortagne: I'm looking at Antonio's email  
vmassol1 - (11:56): do you have any idea about http://www.parisjug.org/xwiki/bin/view/Speaker/MagninLaurent?viewer=code ?  
tmortagne - (11:56): vmassol1: i reproduce the same cliir error locally  
tmortagne - (11:56): even with maven3  
vmassol1 - (11:56): I'll test once my build finishes in 30 mn  
vmassol1 - (11:56): ;)  
tmortagne - (11:59): vmassol1: looks like title extracted from first header is not interpreted (anymore ?)  
tmortagne - (11:59): testing on myxwiki.org  
vmassol1 - (12:00): tmortagne: yes  
tmortagne - (12:00): same thing on myxwiki.org (so same thing on trunk since nothing changed at this level)  
vmassol1 - (12:01): the question is whether we were evaluating titles containing wiki syntax before or not  
vmassol1 - (12:01): I don't recall  
vmassol1 - (12:01): velocity for sure but wiki syntax I don't recall  
tmortagne - (12:01): well it's not exactly that  
tmortagne - (12:01): it's not about title field  
tmortagne - (12:01): but about title extracted from document content  
vmassol1 - (12:01): indeed  
tmortagne - (12:01): title field has never been interpreted AFAIK  
vmassol1 - (12:01): right  
tmortagne - (12:02): but it doe snot make sens to not interpret title from content  
tmortagne - (12:02): it is interpreted fro 2.0 syntax for sure  
tmortagne - (12:02): since we parse it with xwiki/2.0 parser to find the header anyway  
vmassol1 - (12:03): I see sergiu released the tag plugin yesterday maybe this is what caused clirr to breka the build for some reason  
tmortagne - (12:03): but what is weird is that i'm pretty sure we never touched one line of xwiki/1.0 related code  
sburjan - (12:04): jar installer works  
cjdelisle - (12:05): I just did a test of the rc1 .war file on tomcat and I still see the "unknown macro: spaces" and "unknown macro: tagcloud" after importing the xar.  Someone ought to prove that it's just me and this isn't a real problem.  
vmassol1 - (12:05): tmortagne: just built the tag plugin and it built fine for me locally  
vmassol1 - (12:06): that's really strange  
lucaa - (12:06): cjdelisle: I'll look at that in a couple of hours, ?  
lucaa - (12:06): s/, ?/, ok?/  
cjdelisle - (12:06): sure.  
tmortagne - (12:06): vmassol1: testing with  maven 2  
vmassol1 - (12:07): tmortagne: I built with mvn 2.2.1  
tmortagne - (12:07): vmassol1: same thing with maven 2 and 3, i always get the error  
vmassol1 - (12:07): tmortagne: we're talking about platform/plugins/tag right?  
tmortagne - (12:07): yes  
tmortagne - (12:08): are you sure you are up to date ?  
vmassol1 - (12:08): yes I did a full svn up 30 mn ago  
tmortagne - (12:08): is cliir executed in your maven log ?  
sdumitriu - (12:10): Nothing changed in the tag plugin, I had to release it to have the same version number as the tag application  
vmassol1 - (12:10): tmortagne: yes  
mflorea joined #xwiki at 12:11  
tmortagne - (12:11): sdumitriu: do you reproduce the error when you build tag plugin ?  
sdumitriu - (12:11): Let me try  
tmortagne - (12:12): what is weird is that indeed there is no commit since the release  
tmortagne - (12:12): which mean there should not be any difference between 1.14 and 1.15-SNAPSHOT  
tmortagne - (12:13): unless there is an issue with the 1.14 on maven repository  
sdumitriu - (12:13): Build failure  
tmortagne - (12:13): vmassol1: di you had to download the 1.14 jar when you built tag plugin ?  
vmassol1 - (12:13): yes  
vmassol1 - (12:13): I cleaned my lcoal repo  
vmassol1 - (12:13): so it re-downloaded it  
tmortagne - (12:13): ok then we are in the same situation  
sdumitriu - (12:14): I think it's a JDK error  
sdumitriu - (12:14): TagOperationResult is an enum  
sdumitriu - (12:14): values() is a standard method of enums  
sburjan - (12:15): the jar installer has problems. I am able to install it, but when I try to run it, I get an "Details: failed to change directory "/....."(No such file or directory)"  
sdumitriu - (12:15): It can change signature only if the JDK does things differently  
tmortagne - (12:15): i'm using JDK 1.6.0\_21  
tmortagne - (12:15): sdumitriu, vmassol1: what is your's ?  
sdumitriu - (12:15): 1.5  
sdumitriu - (12:15): I released with 1.6  
tmortagne - (12:16): hmm wait actually i'm not using 1.6  
tmortagne - (12:16): not with maven  
tmortagne - (12:16): i'm using 1.5.0\_15  
tmortagne - (12:16): so it's a 1.5 vs 1.6 thing  
sdumitriu - (12:17): Yes  
tmortagne - (12:17): hmm not very good releasing with 1.6  
sdumitriu - (12:17): Building with 1.6 works  
vmassol1 - (12:18): I'm on 1.6  
tmortagne - (12:18): releasing with 1.6 is risky since maven configuration about forced 1.5 is not perfectly applied, for example you can build things like String#isEmpty etc without any complain  
tmortagne - (12:20): and it make probably built classes depends on some version of class that will fail when executed on 1.5  
tmortagne - (12:20): s/version of class/version of JRE class/  
sburjan - (12:21): also the Uninstaller script (uninstaller.java) fails  
tmortagne - (12:23): releasing with 1.5 should be part of the release process (until we move to 1.6), (note that jvdrean1 and me always release on 1.5 but i forgot to put that in the process)  
vmassol1 - (12:24): +1  
sdumitriu - (12:24): Me too, but this time I released from maven.xwiki.org, since my freewifi connection makes transfer times really really long  
vmassol1 - (12:29): I mean +1 to put it in the release process to remember it  
asrfel left at 12:38 (Quit: Leaving.  
asrfel joined #xwiki at 12:38  
tmortagne - (12:40): sdumitriu: we release on agent-1 generally with jvdrean1  
tmortagne - (12:40): with is using 1.5  
arkub left at 12:40 (Ping timeout: 272 seconds  
silviar left at 12:40 (Quit: Leaving.  
tmortagne - (12:40): and a lot nicer than releasing on our machine especially for deploy  
tmortagne - (12:41): releasing on maven.xwiki.org is not very nice of maven.xwiki.org itself and hudson  
cjdelisle - (12:42): Imagine a project on hudson which when it's started it does an entire release.  
vmassol1 - (12:43): cjdelisle: yes that's the plan  
vmassol1 - (12:43): with hudson deploying to a stage nexus repo  
vmassol1 - (12:43): s/stage/staged/  
vmassol1 - (12:44): now we need to configure that to make it a reality  
cjdelisle - (12:44): Imagine we don't have to hold our patches during release week ;)  
lucaa - (12:45): sdumitriu:do you know how can I keep my firebug active even when I close the panel?  
sdumitriu - (12:46): Minimize it  
sdumitriu - (12:46): F12  
lucaa - (12:46): yes  
lucaa - (12:47): ah, I see now  
lucaa - (12:47): there is close and minimize, with the same visual effect but different actions...  
lucaa - (12:47): almost same visual effect (icon colored or not colored didn't really make much difference to me)  
lucaa - (12:47): thanks a lot  
florinciu left at 13:06 (Quit: Leaving.  
florinciu joined #xwiki at 13:15  
Stulle joined #xwiki at 13:27  
Stulle - (13:27): Hey  
Stulle - (13:27): I got another weird error  
Stulle - (13:27): i am trying to export a page with its children  
Stulle - (13:27): however, i get the following error:  
Stulle - (13:28): 2010-10-15 13:22:47,065 [http://localhost/bin/export/Normung/Normen+-+%C3%9Cbersicht?format=pdf&pdfcover=0&pdftoc=0&attachments=1&includelinks=0&includechilds=6] WARN  web.XWikiAction                 - Uncaught exception: Error number 11015 in 11: Exception while exporting  
Stulle - (13:28): com.xpn.xwiki.XWikiException: Error number 11015 in 11: Exception while exporting  
Stulle - (13:28): and so forth  
Stulle - (13:28): any ideas, any suggestions?  
sdumitriu - (13:36): Stulle: What's the last message in this stacktrace, the root cause?  
Stulle - (13:37): http://pastebin.com/600pMYaD  
Stulle - (13:38): i dunno what you mean in detail so i just pasted the entire log  
Stulle - (13:38): i hope that'll help you  
sburjan - (13:39): ok. tested also on windows. Only thing that fails is running the installer from jar in linux  
sdumitriu - (13:39): sburjan: Works for me  
sdumitriu - (13:39): Trying it now  
sburjan - (13:39): the installer works... but running the \*.desktop file fails on my machine  
sdumitriu - (13:40): K, I'll try that too  
sdumitriu - (13:40): Stulle: That error simply states that you canceled the download  
Stulle - (13:41): well, but the thing is that i tried several times to get the children (and there are some) to attach but all it would show me was the parent page  
Stulle - (13:41): and nothing more  
sdumitriu - (13:41): vmassol1: Is this still true: "XWiki Enterprise is also provided as a hosting service on http://www.xwiki.com"  
sburjan - (13:41): starting the start.sh works ... so it's a shortcut problem  
vmassol1 - (13:42): sdumitriu: no, where is this mentioned?  
vmassol1 - (13:42): tmortagne: xwiki-extension fails to build foro me  
sdumitriu - (13:42): vmassol1: In the installer  
sdumitriu - (13:43): The installer is really deprecated  
tmortagne - (13:43): vmassol1: i just refactored it, i'm checking, make sure you are upd to date  
sburjan - (13:43): yepp  
Stulle - (13:43): okay, here is the proper log for the error i described  
Stulle - (13:43): 2010-10-15 13:42:20,483 [http://localhost/bin/export/Normung/Normen+%2D+%C3%9Cbersicht?format=pdf&pdfcover=0&pdftoc=0&includelinks=0&includechilds=6] WARN  impl.PdfExportImpl              - Tidy configuration file doesn't exist. Using default configuration.  
vmassol1 - (13:43): tmortagne: I'm up to date  
sdumitriu - (13:43): Lists xpertnet sarl, © 2009  
Stulle - (13:43): 2010-10-15 13:42:21,581 [http://localhost/bin/export/Normung/Normen+%2D+%C3%9Cbersicht?format=pdf&pdfcover=0&pdftoc=0&includelinks=0&includechilds=6] ERROR apps.FOUserAgent                - Invalid property value encountered in page-position="all": org.apache.fop.fo.expr.PropertyException: null:2:1224: No conversion defined all; property:'page-position' (Siehe Position 2:1307)  
Stulle - (13:43): 2010-10-15 13:42:21,581 [http://localhost/bin/export/Normung/Normen+%2D+%C3%9Cbersicht?format=pdf&pdfcover=0&pdftoc=0&includelinks=0&includechilds=6] WARN  apps.FOUserAgent                - The following feature isn't implemented by Apache FOP, yet: table-layout="auto" (on fo:table) (Siehe Position 12:122)  
vmassol1 - (13:43): tmortagne: 5 tests in error in -api  
vmassol1 - (13:43): sdumitriu: you're updating it or do you want someone else to do it?  
sdumitriu - (13:43): vmassol1: I'm on it  
vmassol1 - (13:43): ok  
tmortagne - (13:44): vmassol1: ok, probably tests i should move in jar handler or something  
sdumitriu - (13:44): Trying to figure out where those values come from  
vmassol1 - (13:44): tmortagne: I'm blocked right now  
tmortagne - (13:44): why ?  
vmassol1 - (13:44): so waziting for your fix  
vmassol1 - (13:44): well I can remove the dep on extension in web/standard I guess  
vmassol1 - (13:44): I'll do that  
Stulle - (13:50): any suggestions for me?  
tmortagne - (13:50): vmassol1: it's actually looks like an issue with the upgrade of maven or aether i did  
\_melvin\_ joined #xwiki at 13:55  
\_melvin\_ - (13:55): Hi there. i set multilanguage on an choose "de,en" but only "en" is diplaye on the right upper corner. how can i enable showing all available languages  
sdumitriu - (13:58): \_melvin\_: Existing translations are listed there  
\_melvin\_ - (13:58): you mean i have to translate every page?  
sdumitriu - (13:58): The selected languages appear in edit mode, there should be something like this:  
sdumitriu - (13:58): Translate this page in: de  
sdumitriu - (13:59): Nu, you don't have to  
sdumitriu - (13:59): You can change it so that all languages are displayed  
\_melvin\_ - (13:59): wow, i got a:  
\_melvin\_ - (13:59): Wrapped Exception: Could not execute JDBC batch update  
silviar joined #xwiki at 14:01  
\_melvin\_ - (14:01): so i need to choose available languages in preferences and then choose one or more of these in the edit mode?  
Stulle - (14:02): sdumitriu: http://pastebin.ca/1962964 << Trying to export a page with children to pdf does not work throwing these errors  
Stulle - (14:02): and by "does not work" i mean it only exports the page without the children  
sdumitriu - (14:04): So, a PDF is generated, but the children are not inluded, right?  
Stulle - (14:04): indeed  
abusenius joined #xwiki at 14:04  
vmassol1 - (14:05): quick poll: wdyt about deprecating the uservatar macro and instead rename it to avatar?  
vmassol1 - (14:05): {{avatar}} sounds much nice than {{useravatar}} to me  
vmassol1 - (14:05): s/nice/nicer/  
venkatesh left at 14:05 (Remote host closed the connection  
Stulle - (14:06): well, true but i thought group avatars were introduced so keeping useravatar might be more precise...  
Stulle - (14:06): and less confusing... just my 2 cent  
vmassol1 - (14:06): you could always have an extra param  
vmassol1 - (14:06): but yes good point  
vmassol1 - (14:07): althugh nothing has been discussed re group avatars yet  
sdumitriu - (14:07): vmassol1: +1 for the wiki macro  
vmassol1 - (14:07): {{avatar user="…." | group="..."  
vmassol1 - (14:07): sdumitriu: wdym?  
sdumitriu - (14:09): There's the velocity macro as well, #useravatar  
vmassol1 - (14:09): sdumitriu: btw we need to port back your changes to the {{avatar macro  
sdumitriu - (14:09): Yes  
vmassol1 - (14:09): (the ones you made o #useravatar)  
vmassol1 - (14:09): sdumitriu: I'd really like to modify the tempalte system to allow having templates written in a given synatx  
vmassol1 - (14:10): the only solution I can think of right now would be a solution based on the template filename (ie the syntax would be specified in the filename)  
vmassol1 - (14:10): the other solution is a mapping file  
Stulle - (14:10): another bug i found: i got this page and it got a number of children. it's basically a dictionairy so the parent page just has some general information and includes a child page which contains links to all the other children pages (so A, B, ...)  
vmassol1 - (14:10): (template file <—> syntax)  
Stulle - (14:11): now, all the children do also contain include the child page with the links  
vmassol1 - (14:11): yet another solution (but more painful) is a special directive in the content of the template but that starts to be hackish  
Stulle - (14:11): trying to export the parent page with all the children pages brings up this: http://pastebin.ca/1962969  
sdumitriu - (14:11): Stulle: Just tried to export a page with children, and it works  
sdumitriu - (14:11): Now, there are two different things, children and linked document  
sdumitriu - (14:11): s  
Stulle - (14:11): this is weird...  
sdumitriu - (14:11): Are you sure it's the children that are missing, and not the linked documents?  
Stulle - (14:12): children  
Stulle - (14:12): i only get one page in the pdf  
Stulle - (14:12): when there should be more  
Stulle - (14:12): and the other problem it fails entirely  
sdumitriu - (14:12): OK, open the information tab at the bottom of the page  
sdumitriu - (14:12): Are there children listed?  
Stulle - (14:12): yes  
sdumitriu - (14:13): Weird  
Stulle - (14:13): indeed.  
Stulle - (14:13): i am using apache tomcat 7.0.2  
Stulle - (14:13): just installed it last week  
\_melvin\_ - (14:13): Second Question: Any chance to rename a space?  
Stulle - (14:13): \_melvin\_: yeah, there is a macro around somewhere... or snippet or something  
sdumitriu - (14:13): \_melvin\_: http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Snippets/RenameSpace20Snippet  
Stulle - (14:13): ^^  
Stulle - (14:14): oh right and java is 1.6 update 21  
\_melvin\_ - (14:14): THX  
sdumitriu - (14:15): Stulle: try this URL: http://localhost/bin/view/Normung/Normen+%2D+%C3%9Cbersicht?xpage=pdf&format=pdf&pdfcover=0&pdftoc=0&includelinks=0&includechilds=6  
Stulle - (14:15): just to give some more information, i am trying to create the pdf using the pdf exporter panel... but for all i can see the url syntax seems good  
sdumitriu - (14:15): Does it include children?  
\_melvin\_ - (14:15): i'm very new to this. how do i use a velocity macro?  
Stulle - (14:16): no children there either  
Stulle - (14:16): and it's html  
sdumitriu - (14:16): \_melvin\_: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Features/PageEditing#HWikieditingmode  
Stulle - (14:16): \_melvin\_:  create a new page somewhere and paste it in the wiki editor  
sdumitriu - (14:16): Stulle: Yes, that's the content that gets transfored to PDF  
Stulle - (14:17): i see... well, it's still broken for me, i fear  
\_melvin\_ - (14:17): so i create e new space, edit some document and insert this snipped?  
\_melvin\_ - (14:17): or do i use the space i want to rename?  
sdumitriu - (14:18): \_melvin\_: Any document, in any space  
Stulle - (14:19): oh, i just tried it on the second error i posted and there it works flawlessly  
Stulle - (14:19): at least in html view, although apparently it fails to create the pdf there  
sdumitriu - (14:19): Stulle: How is the parent specified in the children documents?  
Stulle - (14:20): "xwiki:Normung.Normen - Übersicht"  
sdumitriu - (14:20): Is it Normung.Normen... or directly Normen... ?  
Stulle - (14:20): that's how it got created  
sdumitriu - (14:20): Oh, that's the problem  
Stulle - (14:20): it is?  
sdumitriu - (14:20): The template uses an exact string match for Space.Document  
Stulle - (14:20): well, the thing is, the parent links were created thus  
sdumitriu - (14:20): So the xwiki: prefix makes the children "invisible"  
sdumitriu - (14:21): That's a bug in macros.vm, #includeChildren  
\_melvin\_ - (14:21): where do i define the from= and to= names?  
arkub joined #xwiki at 14:21  
\_melvin\_ - (14:21): ah i see, its in the html  
\_melvin\_ - (14:21): copy paste just broke the newline :(  
Stulle - (14:22): removing the xwiki: prefix  
sdumitriu - (14:24): sburjan: I think the desktop shortcuts are broken because there are spaces in the location  
sdumitriu - (14:25): So it tries to execute "/home/someone/XWiki" with the arguments "Enterprise/xwiki.sh" and "8080"  
sdumitriu - (14:25): And that fails

cjdelisle - (18:12): oh yea. no pb. Still meaning to make that more modular... After attachments...  
cjdelisle - (18:13): In the end I think the entire registration process ought to be at the application level (unless some other new wonderful thing comes along)  
cjdelisle - (18:14): It would be nice to put XWiki#createUser and all related methods to bed.  
jvdrean - (18:14): the doAfterRegistration is cool, it seems that it happens between registration success and auto login (when activated), right ?  
jvdrean - (18:15): is there a way to put some code to execute after autologin /  
cjdelisle - (18:15): Yes, it happens right after createUser completes.  
jvdrean - (18:15): ? (I really need context.user to be the newly created user in my script)  
cjdelisle - (18:15): It's not possible to get the name of the user by other means?  
cjdelisle - (18:16): ahh security...  
cjdelisle - (18:16): You could change the xredirect field to send the user to the page which contains your script.  
cjdelisle - (18:17): Then when you post to the loginsubmit action, it will send a redirect to your script.  
jvdrean - (18:17): yes that's the option I'm considering (using a redirect)  
cjdelisle - (18:17): Can't really have any sensitive data in parameters though since they will end up as URL parameters.  
cjdelisle - (18:19): I can't think of any other way, there simply isn't any authenticate(String user, String password) function exposed in the api.
